sections.heading: Purpose of this screen
body: The Plants screen shows all Plant Instances created in your account.
Each tile represents one plant (your own specimen). From the tile you can open Plant Details, or use the three-dot menu shortcuts to navigate to related views (e.g., reminders, journal, QR code).

sections.heading: Plant tiles (what you see on the list)
body: Each plant tile displays the plant name and (when available) the linked plant definition name (species) and the assigned Location.
Tapping the tile body (not the three-dot menu) navigates to the Plant Details screen.

sections.heading: Three-dot menu (plant actions)
body: Each tile has a three-dot menu with actions for the selected plant:
Edit plant: opens the plant editor to update plant details and parameters.
Show reminders: navigates to the Reminders screen with a filter applied to show only reminders for the selected plant.
Show Plant Journal: opens a modal that shows closed task history (including user notes). Notes are visible and not hidden.
Show QR code: opens a modal with the plant’s QR code, a short explanation, and options to save (download) or send it to your email.
Delete plant: permanently deletes the plant and associated data such as tasks, reminders, and linked device connections.

sections.heading: Floating Action Button (FAB) menu
body: The FAB on the Plants screen provides quick actions:
Create plant: starts the Create Plant Wizard (a 9-step flow) where you can define a plant precisely.
Sort: sorts plant tiles by Plant Name or by Location.
Filter: filters the list by Location.
Locations: navigates to the Locations screen where you can add, edit, and manage locations used for grouping and filtering.

sections.heading: Delete plant (important notes)
body: Delete plant is a permanent action and cannot be undone.
Deleting a plant removes the Plant Instance along with its related data, such as generated tasks, reminders assigned to that plant, and device links associated with that plant.

sections.heading: If you don’t see any plants
body: If the list is empty, use the FAB action Create plant to add your first Plant Instance.
Once plants exist, you can group them using Locations and manage care routines through Reminders.
